fdd:FDD.titleName: QuickTime File Format with UYVY (2vuy) Video Encoding

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: QuickTime File Format with UYVY (2vuy) Video Encoding

fdd:description.p: QuickTime file format wrapping UYVY (the Apple identifier is 2vuy) uncompressed video essence, typically multiplexed with soundtrack audio.

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: QuickTime file format wrapping UYVY (the Apple identifier is 2vuy) uncompressed video essence, typically multiplexed with soundtrack audio.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Generally employed in post-production or editing (middle phase) and in limited modes of dissemination (final phase).

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: Audio essences of various types, not discussed at this time.

fdd:localUse.fdd:preference: None. For preservation reformatting, the Library of Congress' Packard Campus for Audio-Visual Conservation has chosen MXF_OP1a_JP2_LL (lossless JPEG 2000 wrapped in MXF operational pattern 1a).

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:transparency: Relatively transparent; requires tools to write and read.

fdd:values.fdd:note: Apple Video Codec four-character code, referenced in a QuickTime file as the feature-values element in the QuickTime Video Codec Type. Comments welcome.
See https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q942350 for QuickTime File Format.

fdd:notes.fdd:general: Appendix F of the QuickTime File Format Specification describes the QuickTime Video Codec Type. This type contains the elements profile atom [Track (video), movie]; part-ID [0x20202020 (universal feature)]; feature-code ['vfmt']; feature-value [Unsigned int(32) (a four-character-code) holding the QuickTime video codec type copied from the ImageDescription structureâ€™s cType field."]. The "feature-values" is the four-character-code found in a video sample description. In this instance: 2vuy. Comments welcome.

fdd:urlReference.tag: Appendix F of the QuickTime File Format Specification.
fdd:urlReference.comment: Includes description of QuickTime Video Codec Type cited in Notes above. Note that this document has been revised several times since initial release in 2007.
